page.title: 14Bradfield's Moorland
page.content: This area has a number of patches of moorland. Heather, bilberry and tufty grass predominate.Cotton grass blows gently in the wind. The heather prvides a good cover for breeding birds. Lapwings were seen and heard defending their teritory and displaying. A cuckoo was spotted being mobbed by meadow pipits. A sparrowhawk whizzed by during late morning. The curlew's warble was heard and the skylark sang constantly. The call of the red grouse was also heard. Sadly, litter, in the form of empty cans and glass bottles was also seen, dropped by careless hikers, it spoiled the beauty of the area.
